name: Guaiacum
Relationship: GUAIACOL (in the treatment of gonorrheal epididymitis, 2 parts to 30 vaseline, locally). Antidote: NUX. Follows sepia. Compare: MERC.; CAUST.; RHUS; MEZER.; RHODO.
Modalities: Worse: from six pm to four am

Respiratory: Chest pains in articulations of ribs, with shortness of breathing till expectoration sets in
Stomach: Desire from apples and other fruits
Head: Aching in left ear
Tearing pain in skull; worse, cold, wet weather
Pains often end in a stitch, especially in head
Feels swollen, and blood-vessels distended
Gouty and rheumatic pain in head and face, extending to neck
Female: Ovaritis in rheumatic patients, with irregular menstruation and dysmenorrhoea, and irritable bladder
Throat: Rheumatic sore throat with weak throat muscles
Throat dry, burns, swollen, stitches toward ear
Extremities: Arthritic lancinations followed by contraction of limbs
A feeling of heat in the affected limbs
Rheumatic pain in shoulders, arms and hands
Ankle pain extending up the leg, causing lameness
Joints swollen, painful, and intolerant of pressure; can bear no heat

details: Chief action on fibrous tissue, and is especially adapted to the arthritic diathesis, rheumatism, and tonsillitis. Secondary syphilis. Very valuable in acute rheumatism. FREE FOUL SECRETIONS. UNCLEAN ODOR FROM WHOLE BODY. Promotes suppuration of abscesses. Sensitiveness and aggravation from local heat. Contraction of limbs, stiffness and immobility. Feeling that he must stretch.
